item.title: Rewriting your Git commit history
item.description: Making history in a big commercial project where the commiting must be on a top notch accuracy and cleanliness without confusions in the history of a work flow. Being a newbie I had no idea the first time I’d pushed the very first changes in a very first task that I supposed to check the git status before commiting and even staging. So when I’d sent a pull request to the assignee who happened to encounter the non related file to the task in my first commit.
